remedy: Tea, Honey, Echinacea, Elderberry syrup, Pelargonium
description: Throat-coating properties to reduce irritation, soothe sore throats, suppress coughs, reduce cold symptoms, and have antiviral properties
warnings: Try each remedy individually and consult a doctor before use if pregnant, breastfeeding, or taking prescription medications

description: Helpful for digestive issues
Good bacteria for the digestive system, helps with diarrhea
Soothes muscle discomfort

symptom: bacterial or fungal infections, acne, athlete's foot
description: Anti-inflammatory agent for skin infections

symptom: skin irritations like eczema, diaper rash
description: Soothes skin irritations
Chamomile tea for relaxation, Lavender for calming and relaxation
Breathing exercises and calming music for anxiety relief
Turmeric has anti-inflammatory properties and can help reduce pain associated with inflammation.
warnings: Turmeric supplements should be taken in moderation and may interact with certain medications.

description: Capsaicin in chili peppers can help manage pain by causing a warming sensation followed by numbness.
warnings: Capsaicin cream should be used with caution and gloves should be worn during application.

description: Ginger has anti-inflammatory properties and can help with pain relief and nausea.
warnings: Excessive ginger consumption may cause digestive issues.

description: Shiitake mushrooms contain lentinan, which can boost the immune system and have antioxidant effects.
warnings: Individuals with mushroom allergies should avoid shiitake mushrooms.

description: Eucalyptus oil contains 1,8-cineole, which can provide pain relief and has anti-inflammatory effects.
warnings: Eucalyptus oil should not be inhaled by individuals with asthma or respiratory issues.

description: Lavender can help with migraine, anxiety, and stress relief through aromatherapy and ingestion.
warnings: Direct application of lavender essential oil may cause skin irritation.

description: Peppermint can help with muscle pain relief and digestive issues like IBS.
warnings: Peppermint oil should be diluted before use to avoid skin irritation.

description: Fenugreek can help increase milk production in breastfeeding mothers and has other health benefits.
warnings: Individuals with certain medical conditions should consult a doctor before using fenugreek.

description: Magnesium-rich foods can help with muscle pain, fatigue, and overall well-being.
warnings: Excessive magnesium intake may cause digestive issues.

description: Peppermint oil might help with irritable bowel syndrome, a long-term condition that can cause cramps, bloating, gas, diarrhea, and constipation.
warnings: More studies are needed to see how much it helps and why.

description: Honey may work just as well for a cough as over-the-counter medicines, especially helpful for children who aren’t old enough to take those.
warnings: Don’t give honey to an infant or a toddler younger than 1 due to the risk of rare but serious food poisoning.

description: Ginger has been used for thousands of years in Asian medicine to treat stomachaches, diarrhea, and nausea, with studies showing it works for nausea and vomiting.
warnings: Not necessarily good for everyone, as some people may experience tummy trouble, heartburn, diarrhea, and gas.

description: Chicken soup can be good for a cold, easing symptoms and helping you get rid of it sooner, while also curbing swelling and clearing out nasal fluids.
A hot bath is good for conditions affecting muscles, bones, and tendons like arthritis, back pain, and joint pain, helping to improve blood flow to affected areas.
warnings: Don’t make the bath too hot, especially if you have a skin condition.

description: Using an ice pack in the first 48 hours after an injury can help with pain and swelling, also useful for injuries causing pain and swelling repeatedly.
warnings: Never use ice for more than 20 minutes and take it off if your skin gets red.

description: Petroleum jelly can help your skin retain moisture and prevent chafing, useful for various skin protection purposes.
When you're hydrated, your body has a natural ability to flush germs out of your system.

remedy: getting the vitamin through your diet
description: While vitamin C hasn't been proven to prevent cold symptoms, some studies have indicated it can shorten the lifespan of a cold. Plus, it boosts your overall health, including your immune system.
warnings: Overdoing it on vitamin C supplements (not dietary vitamin C) can lead to upset stomach and kidney stones.

description: Sleep helps your immune system function at its best to ward off nasty viruses and bacteria.

remedy: adding honey to ginger or cinnamon tea
description: Honey has natural antiviral and antimicrobial properties. It can relieve a scratchy throat and keep you hydrated.
Hot liquids help reduce mucus buildup and keep you hydrated. Chicken soup has anti-inflammatory properties that can help reduce cold symptoms.

remedy: using camphor or menthol salve around the nose
description: Aromatherapy can help break up mucus and reduce congestion. Breathing in essential oils like peppermint and eucalyptus can also help.

remedy: taking a steamy shower or sauna
description: A steamy shower or sauna can act as a decongestant. It is important to sit in a chair if you are dizzy or weak from the flu.
Gargling warm salt water can help relieve a sore throat.

remedy: sleeping with an extra pillow under your head
description: Sleeping with an extra pillow can help your sinuses drain.
Nasal irrigation can help irrigate and hydrate nasal passages, but it should be done safely. Consult with your doctor before starting nasal irrigation therapy.
warnings: Never use tap water for nasal irrigation as it can lead to a rare but potentially deadly brain infection. Use boiled and cooled tap water, sterile or distilled water, or saline solution.

description: Some people find relief from cold symptoms with herbal supplements like echinacea or zinc, but it's important to consult with your healthcare provider before trying alternative medicine.
warnings: Vitamins and supplements are not FDA-approved and may not have sufficient research on their effectiveness. It's best to discuss with your healthcare provider.

description: A paste made of honey and turmeric can be applied directly to pimples to help reduce inflammation and bacteria.
warnings: May leave a temporary yellow stain on the skin.

description: Local honey can help build resistance to allergens specific to your area.
warnings: Not recommended for children under 1 year old.

description: Catnip can help relieve anxiety and promote relaxation when consumed as tea or supplement.
Natural gelatin containing collagen may help reduce joint pain and inflammation.
White willow, containing salicin, can be used as a natural pain reliever for back pain.
Applying a mixture of meat tenderizer or baking soda and water to a bee sting can help reduce pain and swelling.
warnings: Only for non-allergic reactions to bee stings.

description: Lemongrass oil, with antimicrobial compounds, can help fight fungus causing dandruff.
warnings: Should not be used on its own.

description: Drinking water from boiled brown rice or oatmeal can help replace lost electrolytes during diarrhea.
Consuming flaxseed oil with omega-3 fatty acids can help relieve dryness in the eyes.
Chewing and swallowing fennel seeds can help disperse gas from the intestinal tract.
Eating celery can help block uric acid and reduce inflammation in people suffering from gout.

remedy: Cedarwood, lavender, rosemary & thyme essential oils
description: Massaging essential oils into the scalp can promote new hair growth in people with alopecia.
Supplements derived from butterbur herb can help relieve hay fever symptoms.
A mixture of apple cider vinegar, cayenne, cinnamon, and honey can help soothe a cough and sore throat.
Crushed garlic in water with honey can help boost the immune system at the onset of a cold or flu.
Witch hazel can provide immediate relief for irritated skin and soothe inflammation.
Taking black currant oil capsules can help strengthen nails and prevent splitting.
Applying lemon juice directly into the ear can help fight bacteria and reduce inflammation in ear infections.
Chewing on a mint leaf can help reduce fever and provide a cooling effect.
Making poultices with comfrey leaves can help heal minor wounds and promote skin regeneration.
Drinking pickle juice can help prevent muscle cramps by restoring missing sodium and electrolytes.
Consuming flavonoids found in dark berries can help reduce hemorrhoid symptoms and inflammation.
Berberine supplements can help reduce blood sugar levels in prediabetic patients when combined with a healthy diet.
Taking an oatmeal bath can help soothe irritated skin and reduce inflammation caused by hives.
Drinking sage iced tea can help reduce the frequency of hot flashes in menopausal women.
Melatonin supplements can help regulate circadian rhythm and reduce the effects of jet lag.
warnings: Look for sublingual supplements for faster absorption.

description: Curcumin supplements can help reduce joint pain and swelling in people with knee osteoarthritis.
warnings: Effective dosage ranges from 1,000 to 1,200 mg per day.

description: Inhaling fresh or dried rosemary can help boost cognitive function and improve alertness.
warnings: For greater effect, use the more concentrated essential oil.

description: Sucking on frozen ginger chips can help soothe nausea and provide relief for queasy stomachs.
Soaking feet in a hot water foot bath followed by cold water can help relieve sinus congestion and draw inflammation away from the head and neck.
Applying a moistened black tea bag to the eyelid can help reduce swelling around a sty.
Horse chestnut extract can help reduce swelling in the lower legs and improve vein elasticity.
Inhaling bergamot essential oil can help soothe tension and brighten spirits.
Drinking black chokeberry juice can help reduce the frequency of urinary tract infections.
Green tea can help with weight loss when combined with a healthy diet and exercise.
Gargling with warm salt water can reduce throat discomfort and swelling.
Honey has natural antibacterial properties and can soothe a sore throat. Mixing it with lemon provides extra vitamin C.
warnings: Avoid giving honey to children under one year old due to the risk of botulism.

description: Inhaling steam can help ease congestion.
Chicken soup can help ease cold and flu symptoms by providing warmth and hydration, which soothes the throat and loosens congestion.
Citrus fruits, berries, and leafy greens are rich in vitamin C, which can support your immune system.
Zinc can reduce the severity and duration of cold symptoms.
warnings: Zinc can cause nausea, which may be alleviated by taking it with food and cutting the dose. More is not better—try to stay under 20 mg daily.

description: Elderberry is known for its antiviral properties and may reduce cold and flu symptoms.
warnings: Consult a healthcare provider before using it.

description: Garlic contains compounds that boost the immune system.

remedy: Taking 2 tablespoons before bedtime can reduce morning fasting sugar levels. 1-2 tablespoons with meals can decrease glycemic load of a carbohydrate-rich meal.
description: The primary compound in ACV is acetic acid, believed to be responsible for many health benefits. Evidence-based approaches support its use.
warnings: Mixing herbs, supplements, and medicines can lead to hypoglycemia. Consult a healthcare provider before starting any new treatments.

remedy: Eating fiber decreases blood sugar and insulin concentrations. Barley is a high-fiber, high-protein grain with data supporting its role in improving blood sugar, insulin, cholesterol, and inflammation.
description: Fiber intake is recommended at around 30 grams per day. Barley is a nutritious grain that can be easily incorporated into meals.

remedy: Mainly found in brewer’s yeast, chromium deficiency impairs glucose metabolism. Evidence supports its use for lower blood sugar and A1c levels.
description: Chromium plays a role in glucose metabolism and can help improve blood sugar control.
warnings: Be cautious if you have kidney disease when taking chromium supplements.

remedy: Zinc supplementation can reduce blood sugar and A1C levels, have an antioxidant effect, and help treat complications related to diabetes.
description: Zinc deficiency is common in diabetes, and supplementation can be beneficial for blood sugar control.
warnings: Large doses of zinc can inhibit the absorption of other minerals like copper. Consult for appropriate dosing.

remedy: The gel of aloe vera has increasing evidence for its use in diabetes. Ensure the product is free of aloin or anthraquinones.
description: Aloe vera gel has shown benefits for diabetes management, but be cautious of the laxative effect of the sap.
warnings: Ensure the product is free of aloin or anthraquinones to avoid adverse effects.

remedy: Found in plants like goldenseal, barberry, and Oregon grape root, berberine can help decrease blood sugar and HbA1c levels.
description: Berberine is a botanical with evidence supporting its use in lowering blood sugar levels.
warnings: Berberine can interfere with the metabolism of traditional pharmaceuticals and should not be taken during pregnancy.

remedy: Cinnamon can help lower blood sugar and cholesterol levels.
description: Cinnamon is a flavorful spice that may have benefits for blood sugar and cholesterol management.

remedy: Fenugreek, a seed spice, has been used for centuries for its medical benefits to lower cholesterol and HbA1c levels.
description: Fenugreek is a common spice with potential benefits for cholesterol and blood sugar control.
warnings: A side effect may include urine that smells like maple syrup.

remedy: Used for centuries in India, gymnema shows benefits for glucose metabolism, insulin levels, and as an adjunct to traditional pharmaceuticals.
description: Gymnema is an herb with evidence supporting its use in improving glucose metabolism and insulin levels.
warnings: Monitor blood sugar closely to avoid hypoglycemia when using gymnema with medications.

remedy: Nopales, the pads of the prickly pear cactus, can help lower blood sugar levels.
description: Nopales are a nutritious food that can be incorporated into meals to help manage blood sugar.
